title: Healthcare-Social Practice Competency Enhancement Course for Supporting Chronic Patient Self-Management

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in high-level project execution, foundational medical knowledge related to chronic disease management, and understanding of social determinants (culture, economy, education level, etc.)
context.additional_context: Blended learning approach combining theory and practice, including simple online activities via smartphones. Strengthens educational design considering community resource linkages and case analyses of citizen-participatory models.

learning_goals: Explain ≥3 self-management strategies suitable for chronic disease patients in social and medical contexts.
Applying the COM-B model (capability, opportunity, motivation) enables the development of personalized support plans that consider patients' health rights and social environments
Utilizing educational enablement and capacity-building techniques allows for designing collaborative strategies among patients, healthcare providers, and communities

Learners will develop one self-management support tool (e.g., symptom-tracking app, medication checklist) applicable to real clinical settings (hospitals, clinics, etc.) through a 4-week project-based assessment, achieving ≥4 points (on a 5-point scale) in at least four of five expert evaluation rubric criteria: effectiveness, practicality, creativity, social relevance, and technical completeness

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
